intro: Costus pauciflorus, commonly known as the few-flowered costus, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and turmeric. The plant features narrow, sword-shaped leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in a spike. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a distinct aromatic scent. Costus pauciflorus prefers well-drained soil and partial shade, making it suitable for tropical and subtropical gardens.
